page.title: 17Mobile shops Exbourne & S.C.
page.content: Milk is delivered Mondays,Wednesdays and Fridays.Any other milk required has to be fetched from the village shop/Post Office. The baker delivers once a week. A fishmonger also delivers fresh fish once a week. The Post office owners will deliver groceries,in an emergency,but not usually. However,in both villages,people agreed that a friend or neighbour going into Okehampton,or Exeter,will fetch things unobtainable in the village. Despite the rising costs,the mobile shops do provide a vital service in rural communities,as do the Post offices/general stores.However there is no way they can be competative with the supermarkets in town.They must be used by the local consumers to survive and without them-the village dies.
